name: node-red-node-ademco
description: A Node-RED node to Parse Ademco Panel Messages.
readme: node-red-node-ademco ==================== Node-RED node that parses AD2USB/Ademco Panel Messages. Install ------- Run the following command in the root directory of your Node-RED install npm install node-red-node-ademco Usage ----- Using either the Serial Node as an input or through MQTT, where the msg.payload contains the AD2USB panel decoded message, the node will parse and format the message into a javascript object and either return every message formated or only when the primary arming state has changed from the prior state. (note that a "Deploy" will flush prior states and the next messages will be sent in the output. { "partitionNumber": 2, "messageLine1": "2 ARMED AWAY", "messageLine2": "** ALL SECURE *", "lastUpdated": "2015-07-21T13:31:11.526Z", "systemState": 3, "lastTransitionDate": "2015-07-21T13:31:11.526Z", "lastSystemState": 1, "panels": [ 17 ], "zoneFaults": [], "partitionReady": false, "partitionArmedAway": true, "partitionArmedStay": false, "backlight": false, "programmingMode": false, "beepCount": "0", "zoneBypass": false, "linePower": true, "chimeEnabled": true, "alarmOccurred": false, "alarmSounding": false, "batteryLow": false, "delayOff": false, "fireAlarm": false, "zoneFaulted": false, "perimeterOnly": false, "stateChange": true } SystemState values DISARMED : 0, // Partition is in an unknown state or initialized NOT_READY : 1, // Partition is Disarmed but but not ready to arm (One or more Faults) READY : 2, // Partition is Disarmed but ready to arm (No Faults) ARMED_AWAY : 3, // Partition is Armed Away, Motion Detection active ARMED_STAY : 4, // Partition is Armed Stat, Motion Detection not active ARMED_INSTANT : 5, // Partition is Armed Instant, Motion Detection not active (No Entry Delay) ALARM : 6, // Partition is in a Faulted Alarm State FIRE_ALARM : 7 // Partition is in a Faulted Fire Alarm State
